channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: September 17 Marvell Semiconductor Info Session for RPI Students Only
item.description: From 5:30PM to 6:30PM EDT on Tuesday, September 17 in Low/CII 3112, students are welcome to attend this special session to learn more about Marvell, Inc, a leading semiconductor company at the forefront of data innovation, and the exciting internship opportunities the company has available. If you’re looking for an internship and are passionate about semiconductor design, this is a great chance to discover how you can be a part of Marvell’s journey to shape the future of data technology.

item.title: BD Edge Program Student Information Sharing Virtual Session to be Held September 18
item.description: If you’re ready to bring your big ideas and ambitions to BD and make your contribution to their next innovation, attend this virtual session on Wednesday, September 18 from 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm for insights about working life at BD and their focus on developing new professionals. You’ll hear firsthand how BD’s early career professionals in the Edge Program (Technology & Global Services) are developing their own skills while supporting BD’s mission of advancing the world of healthTM.

item.title: DotCIO Updates LabView Software with New Activation Serial Number
item.description: DotCIO has updated the LabView activation serial number for students, so all students are asked to please use this new serial number when activating LabView products on single-user machines. The ITSSC article providing LabView installation instructions has also been updated with this new serial number.

item.title: DotCIO Tech Tip Tuesday: Highlighted ITSSC Articles and Laptop Care Tips
item.description: When you’re a new student at Rensselaer, it’s good to know that many articles are available in the IT Services and Support Center, or ITSSC, to assist you! There you’ll find helpful information about available licensed software, device compatibility, network connections, printing, and laptop care tips. You can also use ITSSC to submit a support request if you have any questions or require assistance.

item.title: “It’s Your Final Semester — Now What?” Topic of ISSS Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Join Rensselaer’s Office of International Services for Students and Scholars (ISSS) for a virtual workshop to learn about the immigration options for life after graduation. Topics will include employment, continuing one’s studies, departing the U.S., and more.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Learn How a Nuclear Submarine Works” Seminar Scheduled for September 18
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - If you’ve ever wanted to know how a nuclear-powered submarine works, attend this session in the CBIS Isermann Auditorium for a discussion and Q&A opportunity! Like spacecrafts here on Earth, these amazing ships operate submerged and independent for months at a time; this session will focus on the submarines’ nuclear reactor, key engineering systems, and more.

item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM - This event, featuring former members of Congress The Honorable Elizabeth Esty (D-CT) and The Honorable John J. item.title: DotCIO Posts Security Warning Regarding Duo/MFA Passcodes
item.description: The Division of the Chief Information Officer is encouraging everyone to please be aware of sophisticated phishing attempts targeting our community, and to not provide their Duo codes in response to any text messages, phone calls, emails, or other communications they may receive. These requests are fraudulent and designed to steal your information and compromise your RCS account.
item.author: Community

item.title: Sarah Davachi to Present “Constants” at EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 7:00 PM - Join EMPAC for “Constants,” a concert by musician and composer Sarah Davachi! Performing a single work of electronic analog synthesizer-based music, Davachi will fill EMPAC’s Concert Hall with gradually transforming musical strata, inviting listeners to an inner world of sonic detail informed by minimalist tenets, formal concepts from early music, and experimental recording practices.

item.title: Help Ensure the Upcoming Reunion & Homecoming is a Success!
item.description: Institute Advancement | The Office of Alumni Engagement is looking for assistance/volunteers during Reunion & Homecoming weekend from Friday, September 27 – Sunday, September 29, 2024. Visit the Reunion & Homecoming SignUp page to view opportunities and to select the time slots that work for you; training will begin September 18. Your participation will help ensure that our alumni and guests have a great weekend!

item.title: Rajani Bhatia to Speak at STS Colloquium September 18
item.description: Scheduled from from 11:30am to 1pm in Sage 5711, this talk argues that, in the context of intensifying climate change impacts, populationist thinking and agendas tempt broad audiences by providing an easy scapegoat. Analyzing how mainstream and extreme rhetoric on population amplify one another, Bhatia turns to feminist critics of population control to affirm the possibility of another future based on the vision articulated by reproductive and environmental justice movements.

item.title: Four Different Engineers Score in 4-2 Win at SUNY Brockport
item.description: The Rensselaer field hockey team scored three times in the second half to register a 4-2 win at SUNY Brockport on the afternoon of Saturday, September 14. All four RPI scores were recorded by four different Engineers in the team victory.
